page.title: 09BRILL C.E. AND U.R.CHURCHES.
page.content: Brill has a United Reformed Church and a Church of England.The chapel,now a private house,was a Wesleyan chapel before the High Street U.R.Church was built.Roman Catholics,Baptists and Methodists go to churches outside Brill.Mr.Bugg has been a vicar of Brill C.ofE.church for 13 years.Regular Sunday services are held at 8am.and 10.30am.Special events include concerts, flower festivals,harvest festival,Nativity and Mothering Sunday Services.A parish register has records of people who have been buried, baptised,confirmed or married in Brill church.Elected church wardens help the vicar with church events and duties.The United Reformed Church is more independent than the Church of England. It also holds bazaars and coffee mornings and helps old people.
